etymology.description: 扌(扌) (shǒu, "hand") + 甘(甘) (gān, phonetic) = conveys use of hand to apply pressure -> to clamp, to grip, to restrain
etymology.interpretation: The character 拑(qián, "to pinch") combines the hand radical 扌(扌) (shǒu, "hand") indicating a manual action, with 甘(甘) (gān) serving as a phonetic indicator, together representing an action of gripping or restraining.

examples.chinese: 哥哥拑了妹妹的鼻子(哥哥拑了妹妹的鼻子)。
examples.pinyin: Gēgē qián le mèimei de bízi.
examples.english: The older brother pinched his sister's nose.

examples.chinese: 他拑我的手(他拑我的手)，让我忍不住笑(讓我忍不住笑)。
examples.pinyin: Tā qián wǒ de shǒu, ràng wǒ rěn bù zhù xiào.
examples.english: He pinched my hand, making me burst into laughter.
